title: London
description: 4-day trip to London exploring British culture, historic landmarks, and the magical Christmas atmosphere

points.name: Notting Hill
points.description: Notting Hill is a vibrant, trendy area, with casual cafes lining bohemian Portobello Road, famed for its busy market selling antiques and vintage fashion.

points.name: Portobello Road Market
points.description: Vintage goods, street eats, souvenirs & more on offer at a bustling weekly market.

points.name: The Churchill Arms, Kensington
points.address: 119 Kensington Church St, London W8 7LN, UK
points.description: Flower-bedecked real ale boozer, filled with Churchill memorabilia, serving Thai noodles and curry.

points.name: Kensington Palace
points.description: Royal palace and gardens, with exhibits on former residents like Queen Victoria and Princess Diana.

points.name: Natural History Museum
points.address: Cromwell Rd, South Kensington, London SW7 5BD, UK
points.description: Landmark museum of animals and natural phenomena, with hands-on exhibits and animatronic dinosaurs.

points.name: Harrods
points.address: 87-135 Brompton Rd, Knightsbridge, London SW1X 7XL, UK
points.description: Luxury department store known for its opulent interiors and high-end merchandise.

points.name: Motcomb St
points.description: Elegant street in Belgravia known for its boutique shops and restaurants.

points.name: Wellington Arch
points.description: 19th-century memorial arch topped by a bronze sculpture, with exhibition space and viewing gallery.

points.name: Hyde Park Winter Wonderland
points.description: Magical Christmas event with rides, markets, and festive entertainment in Hyde Park.

points.name: Ever After Garden - Royal Marsden Cancer Charity
points.description: Charity garden installation in Hyde Park supporting cancer research.

points.name: Bond Street
points.description: Famous shopping street known for luxury boutiques and high-end retailers.

points.name: Louis Vuitton London New Bond Street
points.address: 17-20 New Bond St, London W1S 2RB, UK
points.description: Luxury brand known for signature monogrammed handbags, luggage & more.

points.name: DIOR
points.address: 160 New Bond St, London W1S 2UE, UK
points.description: Luxury label's designer fashion store, also selling jewelry & other accessories.

points.name: Cartier
points.address: 175-177 New Bond St, London W1S 4RN, UK
points.description: Luxury brand founded in 1847 specializing in high jewelry, jewelry, timepieces & accessories.

points.name: Ralph Lauren Flagship Store New Bond Street
points.address: 1 New Bond St, London W1S 3RB, UK
points.description: Flagship store of the American fashion brand Ralph Lauren.

points.name: Burlington Arcade
points.description: 19th-century covered shopping arcade with high-end retailers for watches, jewellery, perfume & more.

points.name: Fortnum & Mason
points.address: 181 Piccadilly, St. James's, London W1A 1ER, UK
points.description: 18th-century department store known for its gourmet groceries including tea and posh preserves.

points.name: Piccadilly Circus
points.description: Famous traffic junction and tourist attraction in the heart of London.

points.name: Regent St.
points.description: Well-known street for shopping featuring sophisticated flagship stores & international retailers.

points.name: Carnaby Street Lights
points.description: Famous shopping street known for its Christmas lights and trendy boutiques.

points.name: Chinatown
points.description: Vibrant area known for Chinese restaurants, shops, and cultural events.

points.name: Leicester Square
points.description: Bustling square founded in 1670 featuring a small park, statues of film characters & major cinemas.

points.name: Trafalgar Square
points.description: Nelson's Column rises above this iconic square's LED-lit fountains, artworks and lion statues.

points.name: Covent Garden
points.description: A shopping and entertainment hub in London's West End, Covent Garden centres on the elegant, car-free Piazza.

points.name: Warner Bros. Studio Tour London
points.address: Studio Tour Dr, Leavesden, Watford WD25 7LR, UK
points.description: Interactive tour of the Harry Potter film sets and behind-the-scenes magic.

points.name: London Bridge
points.description: Concrete pedestrian and traffic bridge that gave a major railway station its name.

points.name: Sky Garden
points.address: 1 Sky Garden Walk, London EC3M 8AF, UK
points.description: Known as the walkie talkie due to its unique shape, this skyscraper features a top-floor restaurant.

points.name: Monument to the Great Fire of London
points.address: Fish St Hill, London EC3R 8AH, UK
points.description: Sir Christopher Wren-designed column commemorating London's Great Fire, with a viewing platform.

points.name: Borough Market
points.description: Huge market under the railway lines, for British-reared meat and artisanal baked and dairy goods.

points.name: Millennium Bridge
points.description: Elegant steel suspension footbridge crossing the Thames from the Tate Modern to St Paul's Cathedral.

points.name: Southbank Centre Winter Market
points.description: Outdoor, global street food market, focused on sustainable and artisan produce; open weekends.

points.name: Big Ben
points.description: 16-storey Gothic clocktower and national symbol at the Eastern end of the Houses of Parliament.

points.name: London Eye
points.address: Riverside Building, County Hall, London SE1 7PB, UK
points.description: Giant observation wheel on the South Bank of the River Thames, offering panoramic views of London.

points.name: Westminster Abbey
points.description: Protestant abbey hosting daily services and every English and British coronation since 1066.

points.name: St James's Park
points.description: Green space with a lake with daily pelican feeding, a grass-roofed cafe and ceremonial displays.

points.name: Buckingham Palace
points.description: Visitors can tour the palace's opulent private and state rooms or watch the changing of the guard.

points.name: The National Gallery
points.description: Trafalgar Square art museum whose masterworks trace the development of Western European painting.

points.name: Madame Tussauds London
points.description: Museum chain for life-size wax replicas of famous celebrities & historic icons in themed galleries.

points.name: Camden Market
points.address: Camden Lock Pl, London NW1 8AF, UK
points.description: Eclectic market with youthful vibe and stalls/shops selling fashion and accessories, music and more.

points.name: The British Museum
points.address: Great Russell St, London WC1B 3DG, UK
points.description: Huge showcase for global antiquities, including Egyptian mummies and ancient Greek sculptures.

points.name: St. Paul's Cathedral
points.address: St. Paul's Churchyard, London EC4M 8AD, UK
points.description: 17th-century cathedral featuring a 365ft-high dome, recitals & a churchyard, plus a crypt.

points.name: Tower of London
points.description: Centuries of bloody history around a medieval castle, home to Crown Jewels and iconic Beefeaters.

points.name: TP1331 (TAP)
points.description: TAP flight from London Gatwick to Porto

points.name: TP1328 (TAP)
points.description: TAP flight from Porto to London Gatwick
